revised_title: Further Experiments on Sound Transmission in Heterogeneous Atmospheres
tldr: John Tyndall conducts experiments on sound transmission through heterogeneous atmospheres, demonstrating the extraordinary ability of sound to pass through solid bodies as long as air continuity is preserved. He also explores the effects of artificial fogs and their potential use in fog signals, and discusses the development of a fireman's respirator to protect against smoke inhalation.
